Animals, Food, and Technology (AFT) Survey
photo_camera Jo-Anne McArthur / We Animals
Hens explore the outdoors and new home at Farm Sanctuary
Our Animals, Food, and Technology (AFT) survey tracks attitudes towards animal farming and animal product alternatives in the US. The survey was first conducted in 2017, and we have since completed three further iterations in 2019, 2020, and 2021. On this page you can find links to our AFT reports and data. For any questions about the survey please contact jacy@sentienceinstitute.org.

Reports

July 15, 2022
Animals, Food, and Technology (AFT) Survey: 2021 Update
Ali Ladak and Jacy Reese Anthis

Ali Ladak and Jacy Reese Anthis

Jacy Reese Anthis

Data Download


The data for all years of the AFT can be downloaded at the link below. Please feel free to use this data in your own research.
Animals, Food, and Technology (AFT) Pooled 2017–2021 Data

Please cite this data as follows:
Anthis, Jacy Reese; Ladak, Ali (2022), “Animals, Food, and Technology (AFT) Survey 2017–2021”, Mendeley Data, V1, doi: 10.17632/k3xcndsswk.1
Sentience Institute participates in the Center for Open Science's Open Data badge program. We grant the Open Data badge based on two criteria: the published article (1) provides the URL, DOI, or other permanent path for accessing the data in a public, open access repository, and (2) contains sufficient information for an independent researcher to reproduce the reported results, though we do not conduct a full replication ourselves.

Subscribe to our newsletter to receive updates on our research and activities. We average one to two emails per year.
